author: keren.flavell
title: Decentralized real estate
description: The housing industry doesn't cater to people living as digital nomads.

assessments.note: The challenge is to provide most possible value for end users. While the business that is presented here seems like a nice idea, I feel like this does not belong into a project catalyst fund, as the funding will basically go into a property investment platform for investing into property of a specific company. Also keep in mind that property investment is something that almost only rich, privileged people will benefit of. I feel like there are at the moment other, more important projects for the cardano ecosystem that another investment opportunity
I'm confused by the title of this project. From the Casaba website I do not get the idea of housing in glamping hats over the 28 day period but more of a centralized a holidaying investment platform.
assessments.reply: The website does include ownership and short stay/ long stay information.

assessments.note: While I think real estate investments has tremendous potential on the Cardano blockchain, I don't think this proposal effectively tries to solve a problem using blockchain. If they are a private company legally owning the properties in a centralized way, I don't see a benefit of building a decentralized app.  I don't think the proposal effectively adresses the challenge of building dapps that will benefit the Cardano community.
Seems to be a plan to buy land and sell /rent apartments on it. Not clear how it is a DApp.
assessments.reply: The success of booking and management apps - such as Airbnb - demonstrates value of having an app. Not sure why the CA does not see this would not be useful as a DApp based on blockchain.

assessments.note: The idea is of this development is very good and is a good application of smart contracts. I would have liked to see more information about the tokenomics of this project. Will there be a token for the platform, or it will use ADA directly? Also, I understood based on the comment section that not only owners will be able to book houses, but any user, but it was not clear in the proposal itself. Some more information about the fees associated to the booking system and other details should also be included.

The problem statement is subjective, no data has been included to support the problem. It is not as if the industry does not serve digital nomads, there are apps like Airbnb that serve as a mechanism for renting and booking properties efficiently.

It has been described that there will be the possibility of fractional ownership, but What benefit does this proposal seek to bring in relation to the current options? What is the purpose of using a dapp / blockchain? Will fractional purchases be permitted through Cardano's blockchains? These are basic aspects to understand the relevance of the proposal for this challenge.

Although the preparation of a technical specifications document is foreseen as the first phase of the project, it is important to describe at least one rationale of how dapp will work and how it will use the blockchain, without it it is difficult to assess how the proposal addresses the challenge and how it can impact Cardano's blockchain.

Relevant KPIs have been included, which helps the impact assessment.
assessments.reply: Unfortunately I cannot see the full reasons submitted by this person as the cells cannot be opened (or text wrapped).

assessments.note: Despite the plan not being super detailed, I think it is likely that it will be sucessfully implemented, as the proposer plans to hire developers to implement it, meaning that it is most likely to be done by a versed person.

I'm no coder or developer but I strongly feel that feel the budget of 10k could not meet the coding challenge this Dapp intended to cover.
( 1. Make investments, 2. Monitor investments
3. Book time:). I see that a disproportionate amount of funding is dedicated to promotion and packaging of the Dapp and this makes me sad I I feel there is a great potential for decentralised community owned P2P run 'Mountain-Huts-in-the Wild' Dapp, (rather than a centralised realestate investment platform) here which I'm afraid hasn't been explained by the team members in the slightest by the proposer.

They may be experienced in software development and real estate, but I am not sure they understand blockchain very well. It looks to me like they should build a regular, centralized app instead. I don't see anything in the products that needs to be a dapp.
assessments.reply: This CA has overlooked the opportunity for a world-class, award-winning producer to work with Cardano developers to produce a leading edge blockchain investment and booking app.

assessments.note: Plan doesn't really detail what will be done in terms of blockchain. No evidence given of proposers experience.
assessments.reply: Proposers experience has been included, as well as website with full team.

assessments.note: Based on the alleged experience, roadmap and also in the budget breakdown that allocates $10k to the dApps developer, I believe that this project is feasible with the proposed budget. The team is also already engaged, there is a running website with good information and well designed. I don't see big challenges in implementing this, besides some legal risks involved that might be there but were not foreseen.

It is not clear how many people will participate in the proposal. On the Kasaba website it is possible to verify that the Kasaba team has experience in implementing a business plan, but who will actually participate in the proposal? Is there anyone with knowledge in developing smart contracts and knowledge in Plutus? There is no information about who will develop dapp. I recommend that this information be clarified / included.
There is a budget breakdown. What was the reference used for setting the $ 10,000 budget for a DApp developer?
assessments.reply: I believe I have detailed the roles required and validated by experience in assembling world class teams. I produced The Best Entertainment Website (Gold Hugo Award) Chicago International Film Festival.

assessments.note: The proposal is basically described as an investment and booking platform for real estate. Since this is something that already exists outside blockchain environments, it becomes clear that it is indeed feasible. The proposal however does not give a clear explanation on how it adresses the challenge of benefiting most possible cardano users and also does not explain why this needs to be implemented in a blockchain environment and needs funds in order to do that.

No, unfortunately this lovely project is not showing (as one of the comments says) how or why booking and investment monitoring Dapp needs to be decentralised for the success of the project. The proposer is running a centralized B2C enterprise and P2P transactions are in the current business model sadly superfluous.

I don't think they have explained very well how this would positively impact the Cardano community. I think we need to build the dapps that will bring the most users to Cardano first. I don't think this will do it, and I don't understand what problem the dapp will solve.
Please detail how this addresses the challenge. It seems like a standard real estate investment idea loosely tied to blockchain.
assessments.reply: A mass market fractional ownership tool based on blockchain can revolutionize the way we cooperative own property and housing assets.

assessments.note: The roadmap is clear with well defined dates. KPIs are good, but I believe there could be other KPIs related to other metric like number of users, visitors, people registered, number of bookings, etc. Budget breakdown is good. It would be good also to have some mapped risks associated with the project, as currently there are no risks mapped.

There are no details on how many people will participate in the proposal and details on the qualifications and experiences related to the technical requirements to develop the blockchain integration.

There are details on the budget allocation. Relevant KPIs have been described. There is a well-defined timeline, but the deliverables described in the timeline are not clear indicators of development. When will a functional version of the dApp be delivered?

I recommend including more information to measure the success of the proposal.

solution: A tokenized platform for real estate investment and bookings, connecting people to a global community of nomads living this lifestyle.
experience:
Over 30+ years in software industry / multi-award winner / interactive media thought leader  
25+ years real estate investing in 3 countries
